title: Do I need a visa for Uzbekistan?
content: This depends on your nationality. Check with the Uzbek embassy or consulate in your home country well in advance of your trip to determine visa requirements and application procedures

title: What is the currency in Uzbekistan?
content: The Uzbekistani Som (UZS) is the national currency. Hant Travel can advise on reputable currency exchange locations and the best exchange rates. ATMs are becoming more common in Uzbekistan's major cities, but it's always wise to carry some cash upon arrival.

title: What to Wear
content: Uzbekistan has a continental climate with hot summers and cold winters. Pack accordingly for the season you'll be traveling. Conservative dress is appreciated, especially outside of major cities. Long pants and shirts with sleeves are recommended, particularly when visiting religious sites.

title: Bargaining
content: Bargaining is expected at markets and bazaars. Be polite and have fun with the negotiation process!

title: Food & Drink
content: Uzbek cuisine is delicious and flavorful. Be adventurous and try new dishes! Tap water is not generally safe to drink, so stick to bottled water.
